voicesplitting.parsing

Class MidiWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.parsing.MidiWriter

  • public class MidiWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    A MidiWriter is able to take in MidiNotes and a TimeTracker, and write them out to a valid Midi File.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 28 July, 2015

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.File outFile
      The File we want to write to.
      private javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence
      The Sequence containing the Midi data we are going to write out.
      private TimeTracker timeTracker
      The TimeTracker for this Midi data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MidiWriter(java.io.File outFile, TimeTracker tt)
      Create a new MidiWriter to write out to the given File.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MidiWriter

        public MidiWriter(java.io.File outFile,
          TimeTracker tt)
           throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Create a new MidiWriter to write out to the given File.
        Parameters:
        outFile - outFile
        tt - timeTracker
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If somehow the TimeTracker has an invalid PPQ value.

    • Method Detail

      • writeTimeTracker

        private void writeTimeTracker()
                       throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Write the proper TimeTracker events out to our sequence.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If the TimeTracker contained invalid Midi data.

      • writeKeySignature

        private void writeKeySignature(KeySignature keySignature,
                     long tick)
                        throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Write the given key signature out to sequence at the given tick.
        Parameters:
        keySignature - The key signature to write.
        tick - The tick at which to write it.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If the key signature produces invalid Midi data.

      • writeTimeSignature

                      long tick)
                         throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Write the given time signature out to sequence at the given tick.
        Parameters:
        timeSignature - The time signature to write.
        tick - The tick at which to write it.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If the time signature contained invalid Midi data.

                 throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Write the given tempo out to sequence at the given tick.

        tick - The tick at which to write it.
